It’s been 290 days since the House passed background checks on all gun sales.

@senatemajldr: Do your job and bring background checks to a vote in the Senate.

7 years ago, a gunman murdered 20 students and 6 educators at Sandy Hook Elementary.

Today, the GOP would rather let students go through the trauma of shooter drills than act to end the gun violence epidemic.

For the lives lost that day and every day since, we can’t give up.

“These neighborhoods are our neighborhoods, and these children are our children.”

In the years since Sandy Hook, we’ve mobilised, passed legislation, won elections on gun reform.

Let’s remember this tragic day. Then let’s redouble our efforts. https://t.co/gfe6LMyqR2

Seven years ago today, 20 children and 6 educators were killed in a shooting at Sandy Hook in Newton.

Yet 2,555 days later, still no action on common sense gun safety legislation.

Our first responsibility as parents & public servants is to keep our children safe.

We must act. https://t.co/hXBtx5iNi4
Kick him out. Take the gun out of that cowards hands. Now. He’s a disgrace. https://t.co/tb7d0Ghmx6

Today, the GOP would rather let students go through the trauma of shooter drills than act to end the gun violence epidemic.

For the lives lost that day and every day since, we can’t give up.

It has been seven years since the tragic shooting at #SandyHook Elementary School. Today, we continue to grieve, and we remain inspired by the courageous action of so many to stop the epidemic of gun violence that is shattering American communities. https://t.co/HDmOkxC7G5 https://t.co/MBCyh82tnP

@wallerABC7 A bipartisan House bill H.R 674,  against gun violence, has been sitting on Mitch McConnell‘s desk for 11 months now, and he refuses to bring it to the Senate for resolution. When you see these faces- think about that. And shame on you, @senatemajldr.

They have been dead longer than they were alive: these 20 first graders were murdered 7 years ago today at #SandyHook - and we are still fighting for #GunReformNow against the gun lobby and its Washington Republican enablers. Enough is enough - give us a vote! https://t.co/3JsLd0C17v

On this heartwrenching anniversary, I look at my 3 & 5 year old kids and feel so deeply sad & angry for the families who have lost theirs. Each step we take toward protecting our communities matters. There is so much we can and will still do to protect our kids from gun violence. https://t.co/2R0KozGfQG
@da_two_gun_kid Never heard of this in my life lmaooo @prisxc_  what ???? Lmaooo

On this seventh anniversary of the Sandy Hook tragedy, let us not forget the many lives lost & families devastated by such a senseless act of violence. Let us honor the victims of Newtown & of other incidents of mass shootings by enacting much needed gun control legislation. https://t.co/QtCh0nsbsn

Seven years ago today we lost these innocent victims in the Sandy Hook shooting.  Since then, too many more including my daughter.  This is why we must defeat the gun lobby and focus on gun safety.  Your lives and your safety are worth it. https://t.co/FMyCph3BuQ

Today, the GOP would rather let students go through the trauma of shooter drills than act to end the gun violence epidemic.

For the lives lost that day and every day since, we can’t give up.

@senatemajldr: Do your job and bring background checks to a vote in the Senate.

I know sometimes people don’t know what to say when they ask me for a pic. But last night this dude came up to me and had his friend take a pic of us. He posed w a finger gun to my head and said “ima fuckin kill you” and then nervously laughed HEY MAN FIGURE IT OUT YA KNOW?!

Remembering the 20 children and 6 educators whose lives were taken in a horrific act of gun violence at Sandy Hook Elementary. Today these babies would have been in 8th grade—yet, we still haven't passed gun safety legislation. Our inaction is a stain on our country's morality. https://t.co/nh94V9EAW1
Son pulled out the weapon they murdered Lincoln with https://t.co/PNkmqsA8r6

Sandy Hook happened 7 years ago. That’s another 7 years w/o real progress on preventing gun violence. It’s an injustice to the children and teachers killed, their families & all of those whose lives have been cut short or forever altered by gun violence. We must take action now.

My heart is with the families and loved ones of the 26 who died at Sandy Hook. 

Seven years later, what have we done? The ongoing crisis of gun violence, and the fear that it causes, traumatizes today’s children, parents, and teachers. Enough. It is past time for real action.
